Zehui Zhou is a first-year PhD student in the Department of Health Services, Policy & Practice at the Brown University School of Public Health. His research interests include value-based payment to better align provider reimbursement with improved quality and reduced cost, innovative health insurance design, payment policy, and healthcare reforms.

## Education

He received an MPH degree in Health Policy from Yale School of Public Health and a BS degree in Economics from the George Washington University. 

## Experience

Previously, Zehui worked at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health on several projects, including two randomized controlled trials, one implementation study, one longitudinal study, and three cross-sectional studies. He has extensive experience and training in conducting both quantitative and qualitative analyses using various software packages (e.g., Stata, SAS, MAXQDA). In addition, Zehui has co-authored several publications in peer-reviewed Journals such as Journal of Patient Safety, Journal for Healthcare Quality.
